name: Beef and Okra Bamia
author: najla
summary: A simple but amazing Middle Eastern dish containing okra with tomato sauce and wonderful spices. For a vegetarian dish, you can choose to omit the steak completely. Serve with white rice.
ingredients: 1 pound beef top sirloin, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over high heat

Sprinkle 1 tablespoon salt over steak cubes; cook and stir meat in the hot oil with onion and garlic until meat is seared, about 5 minutes; reduce heat to medium; cook and stir until meat is browned, about 3 more minutes
Remove steak pieces and set aside
Stir tomato sauce and tomato paste into same pot; mix in okra, water, coriander, white pepper, and cumin
Bring to a boil; season with additional salt
Reduce heat to low and simmer until okra is tender, 30 to 45 minutes; return pieces of beef to the bamia
Simmer until flavors are blended, about 10 minutes; garnish with slices of jalapeno pepper
